alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 12 at 1:02PM EST until January 12 at 3:45PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Northeast Kentucky and South Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Northeast Kentucky, Lewis. In South Central Ohio, Adams and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 102 PM EST, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... West Union, Manchester, Peebles, Vanceburg, Rome, Tollesboro, Lucasville, Blue Creek, Rarden, Otway, Concord, Carrs, Sandy Springs, Buena Vista in Scioto County, Cedar Mills, Wamsley and Charters.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
